meanings.definition: A person who is dishonest or untrustworthy.
meanings.sent1: The town was wary of the gonefs who tried to sell fake jewelry.
meanings.sent2: The detective uncovered the gonefs' scheme to swindle the elderly.
meanings.sent3: The gonefs thought they could outsmart everyone, but justice caught up with them.
meanings.sent4: The gonefs' web of lies eventually unraveled, revealing their true nature.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the smooth-talking gonefs who promise easy money but deliver only trouble.

meanings.definition: To act in a deceitful or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: She decided to gonefs her way out of trouble by blaming others.
meanings.sent2: The con artist carefully planned how to gonefs his victims out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: Trying to gonefs your way through life will only lead to loneliness and regret.
meanings.sent4: His charming smile couldn't hide the fact that he liked to gonefs whenever he could.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to gonefs the truth was quickly exposed by the media.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who engage in criminal activities.
meanings.sent1: The police were on high alert for the notorious gonefs operating in the city.
meanings.sent2: The gonefs were known for their elaborate heists and cunning escapes.
meanings.sent3: The bumbling gonefs accidentally left behind a trail of evidence at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: In the world of crime, the gonefs were considered the masterminds of deception.
meanings.sent5: The gang of gonefs had a reputation for being both ruthless and elusive.
